image.altText: Bonnie Jantke looks down as she plays piano.

props.synopsis: Many people struggle to approach the subject of death with family, and what kind of care they want to receive in their final months or years.

title.children: Planning for the end of life can be hard, but it's necessary

image.altText: A police car outside National Zoo and Aquarium.

props.synopsis: Jude Wijesinghe previously pleaded guilty to stabbing his co-worker Tshewang Choden to death in the kitchen area of the National Zoo and Aquarium in Canberra, where they both worked, in 2023.

title.children: Man who murdered Canberra Zoo co-worker 'remains infatuated' with her

image.altText: A group of four people walk our of a court building, with a blur over one of their faces.

props.synopsis: A woman accused of covertly gathering information for the Chinese government has been granted bail in Canberra, despite police warning she could try to flee the country.

title.children: Chinese national charged with foreign interference granted bail

image.altText: Three prison officers in riot gear pin down a female detainee.

props.synopsis: The ACT Supreme Court has made public confronting video showing the moments leading up to a strip search that violated an Aboriginal woman’s human rights.

title.children: Video of events before improper strip search in Canberra's jail released

image.altText: Former US military pilot Daniel Edmund Duggan seen as a pilot in Tasmania

props.synopsis: US authorities want Dan Duggan extradited from Australia for allegedly training Chinese pilots in South Africa in 2012. An appeal to avoid the extradition has started in the Federal Court today.

title.children: Former US Marine pilot appears in person at appeal against extradition

image.altText: A light aircraft flying

props.synopsis: The Australian Transport Safety Bureau says the aircraft likely experienced icing, but it is unsure why the pilot did not attempt recovery actions.

title.children: Investigators don't know why a light plane crashed near Canberra, killing four

image.altText: A wild koala in the fork of a gum tree.

props.synopsis: The construction of new homes in Canberra's north remains on hold after a koala was spotted. Now, a dead koala has been found nearby.

title.children: A koala sighting halted a new suburb. Now, one's been found dead

image.altText: A large concrete sign with letters saying National Gallery of Australia.

props.synopsis: The National Gallery will host an exhibition of art from the Aṉangu Pitjantjatjara Yankunytjatjara Lands three years after a video appearing to show a non-Aboriginal assistant helping to paint an artwork led to it being postponed.

title.children: National Gallery to host postponed APY artists exhibition after three years

image.altText: Pharmacy medication

props.synopsis: Pharmacists in the ACT will be able to offer more treatment options to patients, under changes set to take effect from early 2026.

title.children: ACT pharmacists set to be able to offer more treatment options

image.altText: The exterior of a school.

props.synopsis: The NSW government says it should have taken allegations of wrongdoing by a male school staff member more seriously. That failure left those who reported it so isolated their mental health spiralled and never fully recovered.

title.children: He's on a blacklist to never be employed in public schools. He still works with kids

image.altText: He Weidong in formal military clothing standing while frowning next to Xi Jinping in a black suit and blue tie

props.synopsis: He Weidong, China's second-most-senior general, and navy admiral Miao Hua, the military's former top political officer, have been accused of "serious duty-related crimes involving an extremely large amount of money".

title.children: China expels top-ranking military leaders from Communist Party

image.altText: Donald Trump in a dark suit, white shirt and red tie gesturing with his right hand while speaking at a presidential lectern

props.synopsis: The US military has launched six strikes on Venezuelan vessels the Trump administration claims were involved in drugs trafficking, and some are warning the intervention is threatening to spark an all-out war.

title.children: Trump prides himself on never having started a war. That could soon change

image.altText: People walk past an old ornate building with American flags flying in front.

props.synopsis: Australia's big insurance companies were sold off heavily on the share market on Friday after a wave of anxiety hit the sector.

title.children: Era of crippling insurance premiums could be coming to an end, analysts say

image.altText: A group of people sit at a wooden bench in a courtroom.

props.synopsis: The Administrative Review Tribunal was set up to resolve issues with its predecessor, but has struggled with staffing and long wait times over its first year.

title.children: Government review body suffering 'chronic short-staffing', surge in demand

image.altText: A black-and-white, archival image of Melbourne philanthropist Millie Tallis.

props.synopsis: One hundred years ago, showgirl-turned-philanthropist Millie Tallis spent weeks preparing for a major second-hand goods fundraiser in Melbourne, giving rise to the Australian op shop.

title.children: Australia has thousands of op shops. They started with one woman's idea

image.altText: Outback South Australia during the search for Gus.

props.synopsis: When police announced a new search for a missing four-year-old earlier this week, it came with a renewed hope for answers. But the latest search came to an end on Friday with crews finding no sign of little Gus.

title.children: Renewed search for Gus concludes without answers

image.altText: Woman sitting on swings in park

props.synopsis: This game revealed how rarely we are vulnerable in front of our children, and in front of each other.

title.children: The simplest questions reveal what we all have in common

image.altText: A generic photo of two teenage schoolkids sitting side by side, using their phones.

props.synopsis: Some parents may feel distressed and ill-equipped to tackle the issue of image-based abuse and deepfakes. This is what to watch out for.

title.children: Creating deepfakes has never been easier, so what should parents do?

image.altText: John Bolton looking to the right wearing a suit.

props.synopsis: John Bolton has become one of Donald Trump's most vocal critics after he was ousted from the US president's administration during his first term.

title.children: Former Trump adviser pleads not guilty to sharing classified information

image.altText: Building gen Borroloola 2

props.synopsis: Remote NT residents are calling on the government to fund new housing in the Gulf community of Borroloola, fearing limited access to appropriate homes has forced families to move off country.

title.children: Families forced to choose between living on country and safe housing

image.altText: A young woman with long, curly, brown hair sits on a couch. She wears a white blouse with black polka dots and ruffled sleeves.

props.synopsis: Chronic pain affects one in five Australian children. Two young people who experience it want more people to understand their conditions and better support for all children in pain.

title.children: 'I may have arthritis but I am not old': Growing up with chronic pain

image.altText: Police with batons and shields run down a street filled with black smoke

props.synopsis: Tear gas and stun grenades were used to disperse hundreds of protesters who were calling for more provisions for those who helped oust the former government of Sheikh Hasina.

title.children: Protesters clash with police as Bangladesh MPs agree to political reform plan

image.altText: A coin with a man's face on

props.synopsis: US President Donald Trump and his family have reportedly amassed hundreds of millions of dollars from cryptocurrencies. Here is what we know.

title.children: What we know about how the Trump family got richer from crypto

image.altText: Bonnie Jantke looks down as she plays piano.

props.synopsis: Many people struggle to approach the subject of death with family, and what kind of care they want to receive in their final months or years.

title.children: Planning for the end of life can be hard, but it's necessary

image.altText: NOLb_PremierStab_1710 (2)

props.synopsis: David Crisafulli apologises for a remark about crime, made on the same day footage emerges of a random stabbing attack in Melbourne's CBD.

title.children: Qld premier apologises for 'distress' after Melbourne stabbing comment

image.altText: Elderly woman operating computer while younger woman points at a computer

props.synopsis: Vulnerable people reliant on the support of Neighbourhood Houses to live plead for increased funding from the Victorian government.

title.children: 'Underfunding' threatens survival of 200 Victorian Neighbourhood Houses

image.altText: Brad Battin speaks to media at Parliament House in Melbourne. He stands in front of a dark background.

props.synopsis: The Victorian Liberals could be headed for their third leader in less than 12 months, with MPs internally dissatisfied with the performance of current leader Brad Battin.

title.children: Less than a year in, Victoria's opposition leader may be on borrowed time

image.altText: Wayne Swan

props.synopsis: Labor party president Wayne Swan will step down next July and has warned the ALP must boost membership if it is to survive into the future.

title.children: Wayne Swan calls time on 30-year political career

image.altText: Close up of two hands, palms facing upward, under a tap with running water in a sink.

props.synopsis: South-west Queensland residents are questioning the detection of a dangerous amoeba at Queensland Health sites after all follow-up tests were negative.

title.children: Outback mayor calls for new hospital after brain-eating amoeba false alarm

image.altText: Soccer player Nestory Irankunda at a media conference.

props.synopsis: Are A-League soccer fans right to be frustrated when its best young players are sold off, or should they accept it is a 'selling' league?

title.children: Is the transfer of Australia's best young soccer players a good thing?

image.altText: A Ukrainian serviceman carries a shell for a howitzer.

props.synopsis: Fifteen captured Ukrainian soldiers from the Aidar battalion have been sentenced in a Russian court to up to 21 years in a penal colony.

title.children: Russia convicts 15 captured Ukrainian soldiers on terrorism charges

image.altText: Anthony Albanese takes a selfie with a smiling Donald Trump

props.synopsis: Anthony Albanese will "no doubt" use a meeting with Donald Trump next week to discuss critical minerals, the treasurer says as he dismisses a call for Australia to "decouple" with China over rare earth materials.

title.children: Chalmers says Australia can be a 'reliable' critical minerals partner with US

image.altText: Savauge is in a racing wheelchair, wears Australian jersey, cycling helmet, raises her hands in victory as she leads a race.

props.synopsis: The Sydney Paralympic was a watershed moment for the Paralympic movement. A quarter of a century later, Kurt Fearnley, Louise Sauvage and Lisa Llorens reflect on the Games that changed everything.

title.children: Sydney Paralympic Games legacy still impacts athletes 25 years on

image.altText: Ange Postecoglou stands

props.synopsis: Amid growing pressure of his poor start at Nottingham Forest, Ange Postecoglou delivers a five-minute defence of his record as a manager.

title.children: Under-pressure Postecoglou launches passionate defence of record

image.altText: Netballer holds the ball, between two defenders, looking to quickly pass

props.synopsis: Australia has stormed to a commanding win in the first Test of the Constellation Cup series, defeating New Zealand 69-52.

title.children: Diamonds hammer Silver Ferns by 17 goals to take first Test
